Column Comment.0: INFORMATION ITEM SUBTYPE: the type of information item. May be one of Thevalid types of Information item as defined by check constraints.
Column Comment.1: INFORMATION ITEM ID: Unique identifier for the information item.
Column Comment.2: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.3: DISPLAY INTERVAL: The interal at which samples are shown for display purposes.
Column Comment.5: DISPLAY SCALE: the scale at which the well log is shown.
Column Comment.7: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.8: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.9: INTERPRETED LOG INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this log or curvehas been interpreted.
Column Comment.10: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.11: REMARK: Narrative remarks relating to this row of data.
Column Comment.12: REPORTED BASE DEPTH: The reported base or bottom depth of the depth intervalfor this log.
Column Comment.14: REPORTED TOP DEPTH: The reported top or upper depth of the depth interval forthis log.
Column Comment.16: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.17: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.18: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.19: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.20: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.21: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.22: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.23: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
